page.title: 09HEALTH, THEBERTON
page.content: On the whole the people are a healthy lot and long lived, but help is available when required. The area is served by two group practices - one in Leiston, one in Saxmundham, each with several doctors who will visit those unable or too ill to go to the surgery. Foot care is to be had at clinics through both surgeries and referal in case of need to specialists at Ipswich hospital. There are visiting chiropodists and radio therapists for the housebound or patients can be taken by hospital car or ambulance to Aldeburgh clinic or Ipswich. Dental treatment is available in nearby towns. When the doctor with whom one is registered is not on hand, a colleague is available. Preventative medicine is practised. The usual immunisation is available for children and travellers going to far off places
